segment.source: The Windows 10 IoT Core ADK Add-Ons include tools to help you customize and create new images for your devices with the apps, board support packages (BSPs), drivers, and Windows features that you choose, and a sample structure you can use to quickly create new images.
segment.target: The Windows 10 IoT Core ADK Add-Ons include tools to help you customize and create new images for your devices with the apps, board support packages (BSPs), drivers, and Windows features that you choose, and a sample structure you can use to quickly create new images.

segment.source: Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons
segment.target: Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons

segment.source: Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons
segment.target: Windows ADK IoT Core Add-ons

segment.source: The Windows 10 IoT Core ADK Add-Ons include OEM-specific tools to create images for your IoT Core devices with your apps, board support packages (BSPs), settings, drivers, and features.
segment.target: The Windows 10 IoT Core ADK Add-Ons include OEM-specific tools to create images for your IoT Core devices with your apps, board support packages (BSPs), settings, drivers, and features.

segment.source: The IoT Core manufacturing guide walks you through building images with these tools.
segment.target: The IoT Core manufacturing guide walks you through building images with these tools.

segment.source: Folder structure:
segment.target: Folder structure:

segment.source: IoTCoreShell: Shortcut to launch the IoT Core Shell.
segment.target: IoTCoreShell: Shortcut to launch the IoT Core Shell.

segment.source: Tools (Tools)
segment.target: Tools (Tools)

segment.source: Common files (Common), includes packages common to all architectures
segment.target: Common files (Common), includes packages common to all architectures

segment.source: Source files (Source-x86, Source-arm), includes packages specific to x86 or arm devices.
segment.target: Source files (Source-x86, Source-arm), includes packages specific to x86 or arm devices.

segment.source: Templates (Templates), a directory with product template files.
segment.target: Templates (Templates), a directory with product template files.

segment.source: Build folder (Build).
segment.target: Build folder (Build).

segment.source: You can use this folder to store your built binaries.
segment.target: You can use this folder to store your built binaries.

segment.source: It starts out empty.
segment.target: It starts out empty.

segment.source: Tools
segment.target: Tools

segment.source: createimage: Combines product-specific packages into a new image
segment.target: createimage: Combines product-specific packages into a new image

segment.source: createpkg: Creates packages
segment.target: createpkg: Creates packages

segment.source: createprovpkg: Creates provisioning packages
segment.target: createprovpkg: Creates provisioning packages

segment.source: createupdatepkgs: Creates update packages
segment.target: createupdatepkgs: Creates update packages

segment.source: newproduct: Creates a new product directory based on the template file.
segment.target: newproduct: Creates a new product directory based on the template file.

segment.source: newupdate: Creates a new update directory based on the template file.
segment.target: newupdate: Creates a new update directory based on the template file.

segment.source: setenv: Sets environment variables for your architecture (x86 or arm).
segment.target: setenv: Sets environment variables for your architecture (x86 or arm).

segment.source: setversion: Sets the version number of the packages you’re creating
segment.target: setversion: Sets the version number of the packages you’re creating

segment.source: This folder also contains scripts used to generate packages/images.
segment.target: This folder also contains scripts used to generate packages/images.

segment.source: For details, see IoT Core Add-ons command-line options.
segment.target: For details, see IoT Core Add-ons command-line options.

segment.source: Common files (packages common to all architectures)
segment.target: Common files (packages common to all architectures)

segment.source: Custom.Cmd: Package to include the oemcustomization cmd.
segment.target: Custom.Cmd: Package to include the oemcustomization cmd.

segment.source: This is product-specific and picks up the input file from product directory.
segment.target: This is product-specific and picks up the input file from product directory.

segment.source: This also makes an registry entry with the product name.
segment.target: This also makes an registry entry with the product name.

segment.source: Provisioning.Auto: Package for auto provisioning.
segment.target: Provisioning.Auto: Package for auto provisioning.

segment.source: This is product specific and picks up the input ppkg file from the product directory.
segment.target: This is product specific and picks up the input ppkg file from the product directory.

segment.source: To learn more, see Add a provisioning package to an image.
segment.target: To learn more, see Add a provisioning package to an image.

segment.source: Provisioning.Manual: Package for manual provisioning.
segment.target: Provisioning.Manual: Package for manual provisioning.

segment.source: This depends on Custom.Cmd for triggering the provisioning.
segment.target: This depends on Custom.Cmd for triggering the provisioning.

segment.source: Registry.Version: Package containing registry settings with Product and version information.
segment.target: Registry.Version: Package containing registry settings with Product and version information.

segment.source: Registry.CrashSettings: Package containing registry settings for the crash settings.
segment.target: Registry.CrashSettings: Package containing registry settings for the crash settings.

segment.source: Registry.TestSettings: Sample package for OEM specific registry settings.
segment.target: Registry.TestSettings: Sample package for OEM specific registry settings.

segment.source: To learn more, see Add a registry setting to an image.
segment.target: To learn more, see Add a registry setting to an image.

segment.source: OEMCommonFM.xml: Feature manifest for OEM Common packages.
segment.target: OEMCommonFM.xml: Feature manifest for OEM Common packages.

segment.source: Source files (packages that are specific to an architecture)
segment.target: Source files (packages that are specific to an architecture)

segment.source: Packages: Architecture-specific sample packages:
segment.target: Packages: Architecture-specific sample packages:

segment.source: Appx.Main: Sample package for Appx installation.
segment.target: Appx.Main: Sample package for Appx installation.

segment.source: This depends on Custom.Cmd to trigger the appx installation.
segment.target: This depends on Custom.Cmd to trigger the appx installation.

segment.source: Drivers.GPIO: Sample package for a driver.
segment.target: Drivers.GPIO: Sample package for a driver.

segment.source: OEMFM.xml: Feature manifest for OEM packages
segment.target: OEMFM.xml: Feature manifest for OEM packages

segment.source: Products: Directory containing named product configurations.
segment.target: Products: Directory containing named product configurations.

segment.source: It starts with sample update folders, SampleA, SampleB, and SampleC, each of which contains some of the following samples files:
segment.target: It starts with sample update folders, SampleA, SampleB, and SampleC, each of which contains some of the following samples files:

segment.source: OEM input files for retail and test builds:
segment.target: OEM input files for retail and test builds:

segment.source: RetailOEMInput.xml
segment.target: RetailOEMInput.xml

segment.source: TestOEMInput.xml
segment.target: TestOEMInput.xml

segment.source: Image customization files:
segment.target: Image customization files:

segment.source: A sample file that represents a customization, for example, SampleAProv.cat.
segment.target: A sample file that represents a customization, for example, SampleAProv.cat.

segment.source: Customizations.xml: A sample customization file created from Windows ICD.
segment.target: Customizations.xml: A sample customization file created from Windows ICD.

segment.source: ProductNameProv.ppkg: A sample provisioning package created from the sample customization.xml files.
segment.target: ProductNameProv.ppkg: A sample provisioning package created from the sample customization.xml files.

segment.source: BSP feature manifest files:
segment.target: BSP feature manifest files:

segment.source: OEMRPi2FM.xml: used for Raspberry Pi 2
segment.target: OEMRPi2FM.xml: used for Raspberry Pi 2

segment.source: OEMMBMFM.xml: used for Minnowboard MAX
segment.target: OEMMBMFM.xml: used for Minnowboard MAX

segment.source: Updates: Directory containing named update packages.
segment.target: Updates: Directory containing named update packages.

segment.source: It starts with two sample update folders, Update1 and Update2, each of which contains the following files:
segment.target: It starts with two sample update folders, Update1 and Update2, each of which contains the following files:

segment.source: Versioninfo.txt: The text file with the version number corresponding to this update.
segment.target: Versioninfo.txt: The text file with the version number corresponding to this update.

segment.source: UpdateInput.xml: Input file for updating the FFU, lists the packages that need to be updated in the existing FFU
segment.target: UpdateInput.xml: Input file for updating the FFU, lists the packages that need to be updated in the existing FFU

segment.source: Packages with updated contents (For example, Appx.Main with version 1.0.2.0).
segment.target: Packages with updated contents (For example, Appx.Main with version 1.0.2.0).

segment.source: OK, let's build an image!
segment.target: OK, let's build an image!

segment.target: Start with the IoT Core manufacturing guides
